name: IBM Big Data Meetup on July 06th

venue.name: IBM India Pvt Ltd - A Block
venue.address_1: IBM India Private Limited, Embassy Golf Links,
venue.address_2: Off Indira Nagar-Koramangala Intermediate Ring Road

description:
Participate in IBM Big Data Meetup

 

AGENDA

10:00 A.M to 10:30 A.M - Big Data Overview; Why does Big Data matter to you?
10:30 A.M to 11:30 A.M - Looking below the Hood - Key Engines of IBM Big Data
11:30 A.M to 1:00 P.M - Machine Data Accelerator Demo/Lab

 

PREREQUISITE READ UP
Core Hadoop (HDFS, Map/Reduce, Hive, Hadoop job execution).
Following resources are available if you need any quick refreshers.
1. What is? list:
http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL7FnN5oi7Ez9_S0N5H2cu2de2sJNC1FXN
2. Use Case list:
http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL7FnN5oi7Ez90xxvS53HluODkRT1usKb9
3. BigInsights List:
http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLD018347FAFE3F161
4. Review Big Data University Courses:
https://bigdatauniversity.com/

 

PREREQUISITE DOWNLOAD FOR LAB (optional)

If you wish to participate in hands-on lab, please carry your laptop with the following prerequisite with the InfoSphere BigInsights Quick Start Edition downloaded and setup in order to save time.

64-Bit Linux Operating System Minimum RAM: 4 GB Minimum free disk space: 30 GB Processor: x86 64-bit systems InfoSphere BigInsights Quick Start Edition download link

https://www14.software.ibm.com/webapp/iwm/web/preLogin.do?source=swg-ibmibqsevmw

Lab Sample Data Download Link

http://www.ibm.com/developerworks/apps/download/index.jsp?contentid=819530&filename=sampleData.zip&method=http&locale=

Please bring along your own data card - in case you wish to access the tutorial online.

name: Streams 3.2 Developers Virtual Conference

venue.name: WEB CONFERENCE ONLY
venue.address_1: See Description for Details

description:
THIS IS A WEB CONFERENCE ONLY - TIME INDICATED IS LOCAL START TIME. SEE BELOW FOR DETAILS.

IBM InfoSphere Streams V3.2 (referred to as Streams) delivers a highly scalable, agile software infrastructure to perform in-motion analytics on a wide variety of relational and non-relational data types that enter the enterprise at unprecedented volumes and speed, and from thousands of real-time sources. Streams V3.2 includes new features and functions designed to instantly analyze and fuse massive volumes of data and integrates with existing infrastructures. It delivers new capabilities to improve usability, support enterprise readiness, and streamline enterprise integration.

WHAT:

The following new features and functions, which will be covered during the Streams Developer Conference:

Usability:
• Remote Development with Streams Studio for Windows and Linux
• User Defined Parallelism
• Java Streams development simplification

Enterprise readiness:
• Operational Decision Management adapter for business rules
• Access to application data using Representational State Transfer (REST)

Enterprise integration:
• MQTT adapters
• Hadoop Big SQL support
• HP Vertica Analytic Database support

Who should attend:

The event assumes you are familiar with Streams. If you are not, please either try the Big Data University Streams course or review some of the Streams videos on YouTube.

WHEN:

Webcast on Thursday November 14, 2013 from 10:00AM to 6:00PM U.S. Eastern Standard Time.

WHERE:

The webcast will be recorded and posted to Big Data University (BDU) at the following Big Data University course ID.

NOTE: There will be no physical location for this meetup and it will all be online.

To get more info, download presentations, get detailed agenda and to register for the event check out the BDU Streams Developers Virtual Conference landing page.

The detailed agenda will be posted at the BDU class/event page after Oct 31.

Please join us on the live LotusLive meeting webcast. The conference ID is 2058889. Audio in listen only mode will be available on the webcast.

To ask questions during Q&A periods, please use the following conference information:

USA Toll-Free: 1-888-426-6840

USA Caller Paid: 1-215-861-6239

For Other Countries call in numbers use this link.

Participant Code: 7821035

We look forward to sharing details about these new capabilities.

name: Big Data Techathon - Come, Code, Conquer!

venue.name: IBM India Pvt Ltd - A Block
venue.address_1: IBM India Private Limited, Embassy Golf Links,
venue.address_2: Off Indira Nagar-Koramangala Intermediate Ring Road

description:
The Bangalore Big Data Meetup is hosting a Big Data Techathon Event in Bangalore. This is half a day event on April 19, 2014. The event comprises of Big Data Knowledge Sessions on the latest in the Industry and a 90-minute “HACKATHON”.  For more information about what a Hackathon really is CLICK HERE. It is a first ever Hackathon being conducted in this meet up forum, in which Big Data developers and enthusiasts will develop SQL Access and Visualization Solutions for Big Data Hadoop. The software code contest will be around Open Source Hive, HBase or IBM BigInsights Big SQL and Big Sheets. Brush up your Big Data skills and take part in the Techathon alone or can bring along a team of maximum 3 people.

Note: No Registration Fee. Contest winners and runner-ups will be announced on the big Data meet-up web site.  Participants will be provided with required software tools and infrastructure to develop code in the event.

name: Big Data Meetup on July 19th - Sat (10am-1.15pm)

venue.name: IBM India Pvt Ltd - A Block
venue.address_1: IBM India Private Limited, Embassy Golf Links,
venue.address_2: Off Indira Nagar-Koramangala Intermediate Ring Road

description:
We will discuss about various SQL on Hadoop  and explore why such technologies have become an area of keen interest for many organizations. We will share customer use cases for Data Warehouse Modernization and the role of SQL for Hadoop in this space, as well as discuss performance characteristics of SQL on Hadoop when running common query workloads.  

Also hear from the team what are the technical challenges they faced developing their SQL on Hadoop solution, how they addressed those challenges and what are the next set of challenges they see in the evolution of SQL on Hadoop.  We will provide an intro to Big SQL and demo.   Big SQL  delivers some exciting capabilities including comprehensive SQL functionality that leverages advanced SQL compiler/runtime all with low latency and high performance.

Agenda:

1)  Overview of BigData

·  Big Data Landing Zone Ecosystem & Data Warehouse Modernization

2)  Overview of the  Big Data platform

·  Big SQL 3.0 

3)  Architecture of Big SQL 3.0

·  Overview of architecture

·  Enterprise security features

·  Other Enterprise features like - Federation, Workload Management, Open integration with Business analytic tools etc

4)  Performance of Big SQL 3.0

5)  Best Practices on Big SQL 3.0

name: Big data and Analytics session

venue.name: IBM Innovation Center,
venue.address_1: IBM A Block. Embassy Golf Links Business Park. Inner Ring Road. Bangalore - 37.

description:
Our clients are acquiring new customers with data. How is possible to get business insights from data ? Let's find out. Join in for a Big data and Analytics session with IBM.


Date - Monday, 4th August 2014

Time - 3 PM onwards

Venue - IBM Innovation Center, IBM A Block. Embassy Golf Links Business Park. Inner Ring Road. Bangalore - 37.


Agenda Overview -

- Opening Address - Mona Bhardwaj. Manager, IBM Innovation Center. Bangalore.

- Keynote by Shyam Mudambi, Big Data and Analytics Expert.  

- Deep dive / Demo - Big Data

- Q & A / Networking followed by hi-tea

- This is Free event

RSVP - Neha N - nehan1@in.ibm.com

Speaker profile -


Shyam Mudambi is the Development Director for InfoSphere BigInsights, IBM's Enterprise Hadoop distribution. Shyam has been in the parallel computing world since the late 80s, when he worked on optimal scheduling of parallel processes on early NUMA (Non-Uniform Memory Architecture) machines. He came into IBM as part of the Ascential acquisition, where he led the DataStage and Parallel DataFlow Engine (aka PX Engine) teams. Prior to Ascential, Shyam ran engineering at Torrent Systems, where he was also one of early engineers who developed the shared memory transport for the PX Engine and DB2/Oracle connectors. Shyam received his PhD in Computer Science from Brandeis University and has worked in several research labs in the area of parallel languages, including Argonne National Labs (Chicago), the European Computer Industry Research Center (Munich) and GTE Labs (Waltham, MA).

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CmOoGF4k5to
how_to_find_us: IBM Innovation Center, IBM A Block. Embassy Golf Links Business Park. Inner Ring Road. Bangalore - 37.

name: Big Data for Social Good Challenge

venue.name: Big Data for Social Good Challenge
venue.address_1: Web only

description:
CALLING ALL DEVELOPERS .... JOIN THE BIG DATA FOR SOCIAL GOOD CHALLENGE

Big data exists in just about everything we use and do. It comes from phones, cars, roads, power lines, waterways, food crates, and innumerable other items you’d never think of as computers. This data speaks volumes about our collective behavior and society – so let’s use it to do something incredible! IBM invites developers and data enthusiasts to take a deep dive into real world civic issues using big data and the IBM Bluemix Analytics for Hadoop service. Analyze one of our curated datasets or bring your own (provided it meets these requirements)! Use Hadoop and your data to create a clickable and interactive data visualization to highlight insights that you’ve found.

Ready to get started? $40,000 in prizes will be awarded....

Register here:http://ibmhadoop.challengepost.com/

What to Create: Participants must create a working, clickable, and interactive data visualization utilizing the Analytics for Hadoop service on IBM Bluemix.

Data Requirements: Your data visualization must analyze one or more datasets included in the curated list of datasets on the Data page OR meet the data size, content, and licensing requirements described on the Data page. The total size of the Datasets analyzed must be between 500MB - 7GB in size.

Check out the requirements then go get your IBM Bluemix extended promo code and check out the datasets!

name: Big Data Meetup on Nov 15th - Sat (9.30am-1.00pm) at EGL"A" Block Cafeteria"

venue.name: IBM India Pvt Ltd - A Block
venue.address_1: IBM India Private Limited, Embassy Golf Links,
venue.address_2: Off Indira Nagar-Koramangala Intermediate Ring Road

description:
Dear Big Data Enthusiast,

Join Bangalore Big Data Meetup on 15th November to learn the latest with Hadoop on the Cloud for Big Data and Analytics driven cutting edge insight, business intelligence and ROI.

The meetup discussions will have specific focus on Cloud driven Big Data architecture, solutions and use cases. Data analytics, infrastructure, process, technology and culture all need to be in place and working cohesively to maximize the return of big data and analytics.

IBM Bluemix is the Cloud Platform for the World’s ideas. Learn more on IBM’s Platform as a Service Cloud solution  (Bluemix) for BigInsights Hadoop. The Hands on Lab exercises will bring you to speed to get started on big data analytics on cloud.

The only requirement is to sign-up at above-mentioned link to RSVP and stay connected with Bangalore Big Data community.

Additionally, you may invite your customers as well as post the enclosed event brochure at your customer locations too.

********************************************************


Please carry your laptops to the meetup to actively participate in the hands on lab sessions. There will be free Internet connectivity provided at the venue during the meetup.

********************************************************

BlueMix Links


1. BlueMix Registration Link: https://ace.ng.bluemix.net/

2. Tutorial Link - https://developer.ibm.com/hadoop/docs/tutorials/analytics-hadoop-bluemix/

3. Analytics for Hadoop docs link - https://www.ng.bluemix.net/docs/#services/AnalyticsforHadoop/index.html#analyticsforhadoop


Venue: Embassy Golf Links Business Park. ‘A’ Block Cafeteria Inner Ring Road. Bangalore - 37.

Time: 15th November, 2014 from 10.00 AM through 1 PM

Agenda:

10:00 am to 10:15 am   Keynote by Bharat Gera, IBM Big Data Evangelist  – Big cloud. Big data.

10:15 am to 11:30 am   Introduction to Hadoop on the Cloud using BigInsights on BlueMix

Session Coverage:

a.  IBM’s Hadoop Distribution

b.  IBM’s Platform as a Service (PaaS) cloud solution (Bluemix)

c.  Analytics for Hadoop in the Cloud

11:30 am to 11:45 am   Tea Break

11:45 am to 1 pm   Demo and Get hands-on

Session Coverage (Exercises):

a.  Bluemix: bluemix.net

b.  Exploring the Web Console

c.  Analyzing data with BigSheets

d.  Querying data with IBM Big SQL

name: IBM | Spark - The start of something big in data and design (Web Conference)
description:
THIS IS A WEB CONFERENCE ONLY.  TIME OF WEB CONFERENCE LOCALLY IS BASED ON LIVE-STREAM START - PACIFIC DAYLIGHT TIME. DETAILS TO CONNECT TO LIVE-STREAM ARE INDICATED BELOW.  

Apache Spark is an open source processing engine built around speed, ease of use, and analytics. If you have large amounts of data that requires low latency processing that a typical Map Reduce program cannot provide, Spark is the alternative.

Spark performs at speeds up to 100 times faster than Map Reduce for iterative algorithms or interactive data mining. Spark provides in-memory cluster computing for lightning fast speed and supports Java, Scala, and Python APIs for ease of development. Spark allows data scientists to build models quickly and supports iterative jobs on distributed datasets. This means more people can apply deep intelligence into applications to make everything smarter, including the Internet of Things (IoT), machine learning, web, mobile, social, business process and more. 

Do you believe in the value of Spark, in the speed, efficiency and flexibility of this in-memory compute engine? IBM does.  Emphatically.

That's why we're committed to do everything we can to accelerate the adoption of Spark for enterprise analytics, where Spark promises seemingly unlimited value. On June 15, 2015, IBM will host a Spark Community event in San Francisco, California: IBM | Spark - The Start of Something Big in Data and Design. There will be a live demo showcase, refreshments, and a Town Hall discussion featuring some of the most trail-blazing data scientists in today's Spark Community, including:
-  Edd Dumbill, VP Strategy, Silicon Valley Data Science
-  Mike Tamir, Chief Science Officer & VP of Data Science & Education at Galvanize
-   Fernando Perez, Staff Scientist at Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory & Founding Investigator of the Berkeley Institute for Data Science
-   Haoyuan Li, CEO and Founder of Tachyon Nexus
-   Shankar Venkataraman, Distinguished Engineer & CTO, IBM Analytics Platform at IBM
-   Paco Nathan, Director, Community Evangelism, Databricks

Spark Community members will also deliver 5-minute lightning talks to describe exciting projects they're working on.

We will provide a livestream presentation of what these Spark leaders have to say.

To get additional details about Spark and access the live-stream, you can sign up now for a reminder.  Please go to:

http://www.ibm.com/analytics/us/en/technology/spark/

Scroll down to "Can't attend in Person"?  Sign up for a reminder and add it to your calendar.

Link to Spark Fundamentals Course in Big Data University


http://bigdatauniversity.com/bdu-wp/bdu-course/spark-fundamentals/

Link to Spark Technology Information


http://www.ibm.com/analytics/us/en/technology/spark/

Happy Sparking.

name: Apache Spark: An Open Source Revolution Comes to Big Data Analytics

venue.name: The Leela palace
venue.address_1: Old airport road

description:
This is a meetup for big data & apache Spark users and enthusiasts  (http://spark.apache.org), the high-speed cluster programming framework.  We will also discuss other Spark-related projects, including Spark SQL, MLlib, GraphX and Spark Streaming. The meetup includes introductions to the various Spark features, case studies from users, best practices for deployment and tuning, and updates on development.


Apache Spark is an open source processing engine built around speed, ease of use, and analytics. If you have large amounts of data that requires low latency processing that a typical Map Reduce program cannot provide, Spark is the alternative. Spark performs at speeds up to 100 times faster than Map Reduce for iterative algorithms or interactive data mining. Spark provides in-memory cluster computing for lightning fast speed and supports Java, Scala, and Python APIs for ease of development.

name: Apache Spark Hackathon >> join the Digital India Revolution

venue.name: The Lalit Ashok
venue.address_1: Kumara Krupa High Grounds,

description:
Join us and  get your hands 'dirty' with Apache Spark.

IBM India Labs is hosting a 48hr hackathon on Aug 31 & Sep 1 for technology enthusiasts to collaboratively use Apache Spark to  solve the real world challenges based on the following themes:

New digital India

Enabling digital commerce

Creating a safer, clean & healthy India

The team size is limited to 5 persons at the max & not less than 3

Agenda (Total 2 Days)

Aug 31, Day 1: 9am-6pm

Kick-off by IBM

Registration & Start of Hackathon

Interaction with Distinguished Engineers  during lunch

Sep 1, Day 2: 9am-6pm

Completion & Submission of Projects

Evaluation by Jury

Winner Announcement & Prize Distribution

This event is for people who would like to bond with Apache Spark, so we recommend that you have basic knowledge of Java, Scala, Python or Apache Spark, as we wont be able to teach them during the event

You all need get your laptops.

Please RSVP. We will reach out you via email for next steps.

P.S.  Once you have signed up we expect you to show up. Since we have only limited availability your sign-up will potentially prevent another person from coming. If you find that you cannot make it please inform us at least 3 days prior to the event, so we can invite another person from the waiting list.

name: Apache Spark Introduction and Resilient Distributed Dataset basics and deep dive

venue.name: IBM A Block,
venue.address_1: Ground Floor cafeteria, EGL,Indiranagar-Kormanagala, Intermediate Ring Road

description:
We will give a detailed introduction to Apache Spark and why and how Spark can change the analytics world.

Apache Spark's memory abstraction is RDD (Resilient Distributed DataSet). One of the key reason why Apache Spark is so different is because of the introduction of RDD.

You cannot do anything in Apache Spark without knowing about RDDs.

We will give a high level introduction to RDD and in the second half we will have a  deep dive into RDDs.

Speakers -


Paranth (Architect (STSM), Analytics Platform at IBM Labs)

LinkedIn - https://in.linkedin.com/pub/paranth-thiruvengadam/9/771/256

Satya (Architect at IBM Analytics)

LinkedIn - https://in.linkedin.com/in/patelsatya

Looking forward to have a great interactive session.

Continuing from our earlier efforts, we will discuss the next level of abstraction upon RDDS i.e. DataFrames, and also a peek into spark SQL

name: High speed connectors for Spark

venue.name: IBM India Pvt Ltd - A Block
venue.address_1: IBM India Private Limited, Embassy Golf Links,
venue.address_2: Off Indira Nagar-Koramangala Intermediate Ring Road

description:
Hi Spark Enthusiasts,

Pallavi Priyadarshini and Praveen Devarao both from the Spark Technology Center at IBM Software Lab will walk you through on how to develop high speed connectors for Spark. Our agenda for the meetup on Saturday, May 14th -


Agenda:

• Connectors - background, motivation and use cases

• How to build your own connector - code walk through

This session will introduce you to Spark connectors and take you through the out-of-the-box connectors available in Spark and others available as Spark packages. This session will brief you on the background of why customized connectors are needed followed by a developer session on writing your own Spark connectors that covers how Spark recognizes the extensions and how you can write your own Spark extension, illustrating with IBM use cases. At the end of the session you should be able to learn when and why customized connectors are needed and be able to write one for your use case, if not available already.

Venue: IBM's Embassy Golf Links Campus ( Block A Cafeteria)
Please spread the word and encourage your friends and colleagues to signup for this meetup.


Cheers,

Spark Technology Center
how_to_find_us: Spark, Big Data, Insights, Data Sources, Ingestion, Connectors

name: Apache Spark Maker Community Event

venue.name: Galvanize U
venue.address_1: 44 Tehama Street

description:
THIS MEETUP AND LIVE STREAMING IS US PACIFIC STANDARD TIME (PST). PLEASE CONVERT TO YOUR TIME ZONE.

On June 6, 2016, leading minds in data and analytics from Tesla, Netflix, Silicon Valley Data Science, and IBM will come together to demonstrate how open data and analytics technologies such as R, Spark, Python and more are forming a vibrant ecosystem.  The community has a shared goal of working with all data to build unexpected insights and launch new business applications.

The Apache Spark Maker Community Event will bring together data scientists, data engineers, data developers, and data designers June 6th @ 6pm at Galvanize, San Francisco. Here’s the plan:   

- The Big Reveal – New sample Apache Spark apps and tools

- Use Cases – Monsanto will share how they are using R and Spark to optimize their supply chain

- Learning Session - Hear from experts working on Spark projects and building the Spark ecosystem of open data and analytics technologies

- Networking Opportunity – Food, drinks and data, explore a Hall of Innovation showcasing Spark demos

Join us. Learn more here: 

Apache Spark Maker Community Event 

We realize you may not be able to attend in person, however, we are live streaming the event.  Register for the live stream and we'll send you a calendar update and login link.

name: Show Us Your Apps - Apache Spark Maker Build Global Hackathon

venue.name: Global Online Hackathon
venue.address_1: Any Street

description:
THIS IS A GLOBAL ON-LINE HACKATHON THAT BEGINS MAY 23, 2016 AND NOW ENDS AUGUST 23, 2016.  SUBMISSIONS DUE AUGUST 23rd BY 5:00 PM EST. 

We’re extending the hackathon deadline to August 23 - that’s 20 additional days to build your Spark enterprise app. (View the revised competition calendar HERE.  We're giving you more time because....

We’re adding new enterprise data resources to the site and we want to give you a chance to incorporate these into your projects, if you so choose.  Our awesome data co-sponsors Yelp and Uncharted Software have generously shared some of their enterprise data sets for you to use during the hackathon.

Yelp’s data includes 2.2M reviews by 552K users for 77K businesses. The Uncharted data includes Bitcoin network transactions from processing the Bitcoin blockchain as of mid-2014 and Amazon product reviews from 1995 through 2003. For a fuller description and data access, visit our resources page.

Uncharted Software also has a couple cool Spark data visualization libraries you should check out: Salt and SparkPipe.

And, in case you’d like to weigh the effects of weather on business operations, we’re also offering access to the full suite of Weather Company APIs for the duration of the hackathon.

Finally, if you’re looking for a hosting solution for your Spark app, we’re now offering extended Bluemix trials for all hackathon participants. Using Bluemix services to build your project is totally optional, but might be a good way to get your app up and running — particularly with the IBM Analytics for Apache Spark service.

You can request your extended Bluemix trial code here. 

For all hackathon participants, trials will extend through November 1, 2016.

Now go forth and optimize for the enterprise!

---------------------

Build an Apache Spark application to address a real business problem or core concern related to customer care, marketing, risk management or operations. Join IBM and Devpost for a global hackathon using Apache Spark Makers Build.  There are $100,000 in cash prizes.  Submissions can be sent in up to August 23rd.

Participation Details: To participate in the global virtual hackathon, you can register here.  Please review all registration guidelines.

For the hack, you will apply Apache Spark's powerful analytics capabilities to enterprise and other relevant data so data scientists and software developers can build an analytics or mobile/web app that tackles a key business problem in marketing, customer case, operations or risk management.  The grand prize is $50,000, and the top three winners each get a meeting with the judge or
Spark community expert of their choice; the judging panel includes data experts from Tesla, Netflix, and Silicon Valley Data Science.

Go to apachespark.devpost.com for full details and registration.  Please review all registration rules.

Questions?

We're here to help. If you have any questions about the hackathon, post on the

discussion forum

or email

support@devpost.com

and we'll respond as soon as we can.

name: IBM Champions - Call for Nominations

venue.name: On-Line Only
venue.address_1: Any Street

description:
IBM values our community of clients and business partners. Each year, we support and build our community by working closely with IBM advocates and helping them to become 

IBM Champions

IBM Champions are a select group of external advocates made up of clients, business partners and independent consultants who make exceptional contributions to the technical community by speaking at conferences, running or actively participating in user groups, evangelizing relevant technical topics via social media, and helping our clients make the most of IBM technology. 

We are looking for clients and business partners to join the program and are looking for applications in the areas of data science, data engineering, application development, and business analytics.

Nominations are due by Monday, November 28, 2016

The Champion program is open to candidates worldwide, and candidates may self-nominate or be nominated by someone else. IBM employees are not eligible for the program.  Some benefits of the IBM Champion program: 
- IBM Champions advocate IBM offerings in the community with competence and credibility (content, blogs, presentations, customer references, analyst/press, videos/podcasts, etc.)
- IBM Champions share knowledge with and provide support to the IBM user community (books, articles, blogs, forums, presentations, education, beta programs and customer advisory councils etc.)
- IBM Champions support IBM as brand ambassadors who build awareness, share product knowledge, and provide product feedback as users and beta testers

Read this  blog post  for full IBM Champion program criteria, guidelines and the <a>nomination form</a>.

To learn more about the IBM Champion program from current Champions and Worldwide IBM Champion coordinator Libby Ingrassia, listen to this webcast. Be sure to share the blog and webcast with clients and colleagues who would make great IBM Champions.

name: Machine Learning Launch

venue.name: LIVESTREAM
venue.address_1: http://ibm.co/MLevent

description:
The demand for machine learning is booming! 

Calling all IT executives, data scientists, Chief Data Officers, data architects and other data geeks.  Join us on February 15th from 2:00-5:30 pm ET via livestream  (replay available starting February 16th) , and discover how machine learning is fundamentally changing the way we work and live.  Hear about cognitive applications that anticipate behavior and learn from data without being explicitly programmed.

You'll learn about the latest breakthrough developments on machine learning as well as Spark, data and analytics. Mike Gualtieri, Vice President and Principal Analyst, Forrester, will present his view on how to best leverage technologies such as big data, predictive analytics, Hadoop/Spark, machine learning, data science, and AI.  Rob Thomas, General Manager, IBM Analytics will host an agenda which will include guest speakers and cover the following topics:

•  Machine Learning Overview

•  Top Trends in Machine Learning & Cognitive Applications

•  Cognitive Analytics and Machine Learning for the Enterprise

•  Live Product Demonstration & Client Roundtable on Machine Learning

•  Data Innovation with Hybrid Transaction/Analytical Processing

•  Spark & Machine Learning for Enterprise Systems

For additional details and to REGISTER, please visit MACHINE LEARNING.

Register NOW and we'll send you a reminder!
how_to_find_us: Livestream is Eastern Standard Time (EST) - Adjust to your time zone
